title: NixOS Package PRs for dconf
description: NixOS Package PRs for dconf on GitHub

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This implementation is partly based on #189099 and addresses some related reviews. A main difference between this and #189099 is that this implementation is completely backward-compatial.

Things done
  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
  • For non-Linux: Is sandbox = true set in nix.conf? (See Nix manual)
  • Tested, as applicable:
    • NixOS test(s) (look inside nixos/tests)
    • and/or package tests
    • or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in lib/tests or pkgs/test
    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages
  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage
  • Tested basic functionality of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • 23.05 Release Notes (or backporting 22.11 Release notes)
    • (Package updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is major or breaking
    • (Module updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is significant
    • (Module addition) Added a release notes entry if adding a new NixOS module
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.
items.title: nixos/dconf: support generating from attrs

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This PR is a redesign of the NixOS dconf module and provides a way to solve the issues noted in #54150.

If merged, it presents an alternative to extraGSettingsOverrides that is more reliable as the user can disable overriding options with enableUserDb = false;. Users can store their configurations both as dconf keyfiles or as Nix expressions.

This is how the module can be used:

{
  # With keyfiles
  programs.dconf.profiles.user.databases = lib.singleton (pkgs.dconf-utils.mkDconfDb ./files/dconf);

  # With a Nix expression
  programs.dconf.profiles.user.databases = with lib.dconf; lib.singleton {
    org.gnome.shell = {
      disable-user-extensions = true;
      favorite-apps = [ "firefox.desktop" "thunderbird.desktop" ];
      welcome-dialog-last-shown-version = "999";
    };

    org.gnome.desktop.input-sources = {
      sources = [
        (mkTuple [ "xkb" "en" ])
      ];
      xkb-options = [ "terminate:ctrl_alt_bksp" ];
    };
  };
}
Things done
  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
  • For non-Linux: Is sandbox = true set in nix.conf? (See Nix manual)
  • Tested, as applicable:
    • NixOS test(s) (look inside nixos/tests)
    • and/or package tests
    • or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in lib/tests or pkgs/test
    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages
  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage
  • Tested basic functionality of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • 22.11 Release Notes (or backporting 22.05 Release notes)

  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.
items.title: nixos/modules/programs/dconf: redesign profiles

items.content_html:
gnome-keyring needs dconf at runtime and exits with relatively cryptic
error messages if it's not available. Even worse, this adds a one minute
timeout for gnome-keyring to every pam authentication due to the gnome
keyring unlocking module we enable by default.

cc @NixOS/gnome

Description of changes

items.title: nixos/gnome-keyring: also enable dconf if active

items.content_html:
Motivation for this change

I'd like to enable/disable GNOME3 extensions from configuration.nix. However, when testing this I learned that services.xserver.desktopManager.gnome3.extraGSettingsOverrides, which this is built upon, only provides default values for the system. Users are still able to change settings. And once they have made a change, any change to the system default will be ignored. This is marked WIP since I'd like for this setting to be truly declarative. The first 4 commits would be nice to merge anyway, so one can play with this locally at least.

Things done
  • Tested using sandboxing (nix.useSandbox on NixOS, or option sandbox in nix.conf on non-NixOS)
  • Built on platform(s)
    • NixOS
    • macOS
    • other Linux distributions
  • Tested via one or more NixOS test(s) if existing and applicable for the change (look inside nixos/tests)
  • Tested compilation of all pkgs that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nox --run "nox-review wip"
  • Tested execution of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • Determined the impact on package closure size (by running nix path-info -S before and after)
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.
items.title: [WIP] nixos: add environment.gnome3.enableExtensions

items.content_html:
Automatic update generated by nixpkgs-update tools. This update was made based on information from passthru.updateScript.

meta.description for dconf2nix is: "Convert dconf files to Nix, as expected by Home Manager"

meta.homepage for dconf2nix is: "https://hackage.haskell.org/package/dconf2nix"

meta.changelog for dconf2nix is: ""

Updates performed
  • Ran passthru.UpdateScript
To inspect upstream changes
Impact
Checks done (click to expand)
  • built on NixOS
  • The tests defined in passthru.tests, if any, passed
  • found 0.0.12 with grep in /nix/store/ic9sibf4yfrrazm49gxagk948p5lgv6y-dconf2nix-0.0.12
  • found 0.0.12 in filename of file in /nix/store/ic9sibf4yfrrazm49gxagk948p5lgv6y-dconf2nix-0.0.12
Rebuild report (if merged into master) (click to expand) 
2 total rebuild path(s)

2 package rebuild(s)

First fifty rebuilds by attrpath
dconf2nix
haskellPackages.dconf2nix
Instructions to test this update (click to expand)

Either download from Cachix:

nix-store -r /nix/store/ic9sibf4yfrrazm49gxagk948p5lgv6y-dconf2nix-0.0.12 \
  --option binary-caches 'https://cache.nixos.org/ https://nix-community.cachix.org/' \
  --option trusted-public-keys '
  nix-community.cachix.org-1:mB9FSh9qf2dCimDSUo8Zy7bkq5CX+/rkCWyvRCYg3Fs=
  cache.nixos.org-1:6NCHdD59X431o0gWypbMrAURkbJ16ZPMQFGspcDShjY=
  '

(The Cachix cache is only trusted for this store-path realization.)
For the Cachix download to work, your user must be in the trusted-users list or you can use sudo since root is effectively trusted.

Or, build yourself:

nix-build -A dconf2nix https://github.com/r-ryantm/nixpkgs/archive/753e856cdb50c86687b78628d7b8ae299d9b4545.tar.gz

After you've downloaded or built it, look at the files and if there are any, run the binaries:

ls -la /nix/store/ic9sibf4yfrrazm49gxagk948p5lgv6y-dconf2nix-0.0.12
ls -la /nix/store/ic9sibf4yfrrazm49gxagk948p5lgv6y-dconf2nix-0.0.12/bin

Pre-merge build results

We have automatically built all packages that will get rebuilt due to
this change.

This gives evidence on whether the upgrade will break dependent packages.
Note sometimes packages show up as failed to build independent of the
change, simply because they are already broken on the target branch.

Result of nixpkgs-review run on x86_64-linux 1

1 package built:
  • dconf2nix
Maintainer pings

cc @gvolpe for testing.

items.content_html:
it was not working before, exiting with:

Typelib files for Gtk-3.0 are not available.

If you're on Ubuntu or another Debian-like distribution, please install
them with

    sudo apt install gir1.2-gtk-3.0

items.title: gtimelog: fix and update to latest master

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Added fastfetch, essentially a faster version of neofetch.

Source/Homepage: https://github.com/LinusDierheimer/fastfetch

Closes #176799.

  • programs.foot: Always create config file (nix-community#2091)
  • mangohud: add module
  • password-store: add environment variables to xsession.importedVariables (nix-community#2103)
  • nixos: set stopIfChanged to false (nix-community#2105)
  • files: properly escape shell arguments
  • systemd: bring more in line with upstream
  • systemd: add automounts option
  • direnv: add enableFlakes option for enableNixDirenvIntegration (nix-community#2089)
  • qutebrowser: add quickmark support (nix-community#2059)
  • sxhkd: stop scope before creating (nix-community#2086)
  • xresources: load .Xresources in xsession.initExtra
  • programs.gnome-terminal: terminal options (nix-community#2042)
  • home-manager: add home-manager option
  • home-manager: fix nixos-option evaluation (nix-community#2115)
  • sxhkd: minor formatting in test
  • sxhkd: fix service test
  • dunst: make icon_path extensible (nix-community#2097)
  • terminator: add module (nix-community#2063)
  • rsibreak: add package when enabled; fixes nix-community#2092 (nix-community#2118)
  • fzf: also use custom package for shell integrations (nix-community#2119)
  • bspwm: various improvements (nix-community#2095)
  • bspwm: re-add support for lists as config option values (nix-community#2125)
  • tests: update nmt
  • command-not-found: update from nixpkgs
  • README: fix outdated description (nix-community#2131)
  • tests: prevent some unnecessary downloads
  • xmonad: document breakage of recompilation (nix-community#2024)
  • i3,sway: add bar color options for the focused output (nix-community#2135)
  • xmonad: restrict news entry to Linux
  • tests: bump nmt
  • i18n.inputMethod: add module
  • docs: document how to reset the nix-env
  • obs-studio: use wrapobs and the new plugin layout (nix-community#2142)
  • himalaya: add module
  • tests: bump nmt
  • files: assert that target files are unique
  • zsh: add enableSyntaxHighlighting option (nix-community#2144)
  • xresources: Add path configuration option (nix-community#2141)
  • xsession: Add profilePath configuration option (nix-community#2140)
  • files: minor cleanup
  • rofi: add "plugins" option (nix-community#2117)
  • xmobar: add module (nix-community#2120)
  • rbw: use pientry.binaryPath when available (nix-community#2153)
  • foot: revert always create config file (nix-community#2091) (nix-community#2157)
  • home-environment: add Nixpkgs release version check
  • devilspie2: add module (nix-community#1477)
  • xmobar: use dummy package in test
  • home-manager: use nixos-option from pkgs
  • Revert "home-manager: use nixos-option from pkgs"
  • Revert "Revert "home-manager: use nixos-option from pkgs""
  • home-manager: fix nixos-option fallback
  • qutebrowser: add onChange ipc reloading
  • setxkbmap: reset options before setting new ones (nix-community#2160)
  • brave: fix config dir path (nix-community#2173)
  • sm64ex: add module
  • sway: add propagate --to-code for modes (nix-community#2176)
  • xsettingsd: add service module
  • alacritty: add CSIu support
  • alacritty: test for CSIu support
items.title: da alactritty csiu

items.content_html:
Description

Adds programs.gnome-shell for customizing Gnome Shell extensions and theme.

This is take two on #1795 by @tadfisher. Generally just rebased and updated with all new conventions.

  • Changed maintainer to myself as I am not sure if @tadfisher is interested in this anymore
  • Switched from uuid to extensionUuid without fallback (as it was quite a while that landed in nixpkgs and no-one is using this new module yet)
  • Updated changelog
  • This setting is now some kind of gVariant and needs to access the value as such config.dconf.settings."org/gnome/shell".enabled-extensions.value

Checklist

  • Change is backwards compatible.

  • Code formatted with ./format.

  • Code tested through nix-shell --pure tests -A run.all.

  • Test cases updated/added. See example.

  • Commit messages are formatted like

    {component}: {description}

{long description}

    See CONTRIBUTING for more information and recent commit messages for examples.

  • If this PR adds a new module

    • Added myself as module maintainer. See example.

    • Added myself and the module files to .github/CODEOWNERS.
items.title: programs/gnome-shell: init module

items.content_html:
Description of changes

https://linuxecke.volkoh.de/vokoscreen/vokoscreen-changes.html

Things done
  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
  • For non-Linux: Is sandbox = true set in nix.conf? (See Nix manual)
  • Tested, as applicable:
    • NixOS test(s) (look inside nixos/tests)
    • and/or package tests
    • or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in lib/tests or pkgs/test
    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages
  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage
  • Tested basic functionality of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • 22.05 Release Notes (or backporting 21.11 Release notes)
    • (Package updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is major or breaking
    • (Module updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is significant
    • (Module addition) Added a release notes entry if adding a new NixOS module
    • (Release notes changes) Ran nixos/doc/manual/md-to-db.sh to update generated release notes
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.
items.title: vokoscreen-ng: 3.0.8 -> 3.1.0

items.content_html:
This is still a work in progress, properties needs to be added at least to configure the icon size, gtk menu and menuitem scss classes for the system tray.

While this is functional this needs to be tested against various applications.

Description

Add a system tray widget

Usage

For now there is just a (system-tray) widget with no prop binding.

Showcase

see #111

Checklist

Please make sure you can check all the boxes that apply to this PR.

  • All widgets I've added are correctly documented.
  • I added my changes to CHANGELOG.md, if appropriate.
  • The documentation in the docs/content/main directory has been adjusted to reflect my changes.
  • I used cargo fmt to automatically format all code before committing
items.title: WIP: feat: naive system tray widget
